{"metadata":{"objective":"Make sure the parts work together","lastStepAudioPath":"summary","audioPath":"CS16/6/Refresher"},"steps":[{"headerText":"","leftText":"<p><span class=\"ju-cktitle\" style=\"color:#025B5B;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:22px;font-weight:bold;\">Your brother&#39;s letter needs work</span><br /><br />While on vacation, you and your family checked into the Gravel Mountain Motel.&nbsp; Everything that could possibly go wrong did.&nbsp; You survived, but now that you are home, you are writing to the manager to get a refund for the night you spent there.<br /><br />Your brother has also written a letter.&nbsp; You wonder if his letter is better than yours. You decide to review his work.<br /><br />Note: For an essay, your paragraph may be different.&nbsp; <img alt=\"\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" />See the mini-lesson on <em>Body paragraphs for an essay</em> for more information.</p>","rightText":"<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p>To the Manager of the Gravel Mountain Motel:</p><p>The beds at the Gravel Mountain Motel are terrible! When I stayed there, I had a terrible time. I hated staying at the Gravel Mountain Motel. The beds were lumpy and the mattresses were thin. I will say that the free breakfast was hot and delicious. That rude person at the front desk was no help to us.</p><p>I want my money back!</p><p>Cranky Customer</p></td></tr></tbody></table>","settings":{"showHeader":0,"showAudio":1,"audioPath":"1","hideRightPanel":0,"showNext":1,"delayStep":"0","delayRight":"0"}},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"2"},"leftText":"<p>You know that a good paragraph should begin with a <strong>topic sentence</strong> that includes your <strong>topic</strong> and your <strong>main idea.</strong><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><img alt=\"A diagram shows the 3 parts of a paragraph. The first part is the topic sentence. The second part is the supporting details. The last part is the concluding sentence.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","headerText":"Checking the topic sentence"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"3"},"leftText":"<p>Your brother&#39;s topic sentence is:<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">The beds at the Gravel Mountain Motel are terrible!</span><br /><br />This has a topic and a main idea, but it is too narrow.&nbsp; There were a lot more things to complain about than just the beds.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Topic:</span></p><p>The beds at the Gravel Mountain Motel<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Main idea:</span></p><p>The beds are terrible.</p><p><span class=\"ju-normal\" style=\"color:black;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:16px;\">This is too narrow!&nbsp; </span></p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"4"},"leftText":"<p>You revise this to include a broader topic and main idea.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">What is the topic?</span></p><p>My stay at the Gravel Mountain Motel<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">What is the main idea?</span></p><p>The stay was uncomfortable and unpleasant.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Revised topic sentence:</span></p><p>My stay at the Gravel Mountain Motel last October was uncomfortable and unpleasant.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"5"},"leftText":"<p>Next, you look at the <strong>support</strong> your brother has included. You know that good support</p><ul style=\"padding-left: 15px;\"><li>relates to the topic sentence.</li><li>includes facts and evidence, not just opinions.</li><li>is of interest to the reader.</li><li>sticks to the topic.</li></ul>","rightText":"<p><img alt=\"A diagram shows the 3 parts of a paragraph. The first part is the topic sentence. The second part is the supporting details. The last part is the concluding sentence. The supporting details part usually has several sentences.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","headerText":"Reviewing the support"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"6"},"leftText":"<p>Your brother&#39;s letter has this support:<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">When I stayed there, I had a terrible time. I hated staying at the Gravel Mountain Motel. The beds were lumpy and the mattresses were thin. I will say that the free breakfast was hot and delicious. That rude person at the front desk was no help to us.</span><br /><br />The first two sentences are your brother&#39;s opinion.&nbsp; You delete them and replace them with two facts that support the topic sentence.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Opinion:</span></p><p>When I stayed there, I had a terrible time. I hated staying at the Gravel Mountain Motel!<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Facts:</span></p><p>The shower produced only a trickle of cold water and the toilet overflowed.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"7"},"rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Evidence that the motel was uncomfortable:</span></p><p>The beds were lumpy and the mattresses were thin.</p>","leftText":"<p>Your brother&#39;s next sentence offers&nbsp;good support.&nbsp;&nbsp; It is evidence that the Gravel Mountain Motel was an uncomfortable place to stay. You decide to leave this sentence in his letter.<br />&nbsp;</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"8"},"leftText":"<p>Your brother&#39;s fourth sentence is this:<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">I will say that the free breakfast was hot and delicious.</span><br /><br />This sentence distracts the reader from the bad things about the&nbsp;Gravel Mountain Motel by complimenting the breakfast.<br /><br />You replace it with a sentence that supports the main idea that the stay was uncomfortable and unpleasant.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Distracting--does not stick to the topic:</span></p><p>I will say that the free breakfast was hot and delicious.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Sticks to the topic:</span></p><p>The coffee at the free breakfast was weak and cold.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"9"},"leftText":"<p>The last sentence in your brother&#39;s letter is this:<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">That rude person at the front desk was no help to us.</span><br /><br />This is evidence of poor service.&nbsp; You decide to leave this sentence in his letter.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Evidence of poor service:</span></p><p><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">That rude person at the front desk was no help to us.</span></p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"10"},"leftText":"<p>As you read this letter, you think that it would be more effective if it included another detail. You add some information about the thin walls and the noisy neighbors.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Additional detail:</span></p><p>The walls were flimsy, and we could hear loud music playing all night.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"11"},"leftText":"<p>A paragraph should include <strong>transition words</strong> that connect sentences and organize the ideas to make them clear to your reader.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":"Making the message clear"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"12"},"leftText":"<p>Your brother&#39;s paragraph does not have any transition words, so you add them to help the manager of the motel understand the order of importance of his ideas.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Revised with transition words:</span></p><p>My stay at the Gravel Mountain Motel last October was uncomfortable and unpleasant.&nbsp; <span class=\"marker\">First of all,</span> the shower produced only a trickle of cold water and the toilet overflowed.&nbsp; <span class=\"marker\">Additionally</span>, the beds were lumpy and the mattresses were thin.&nbsp; The walls were flimsy, and we could hear loud music playing all night.&nbsp; The coffee at the free breakfast was weak and cold.&nbsp; <span class=\"marker\">Worst of all,</span> that rude person at the front desk was no help to us.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"13"},"leftText":"<p>A paragraph needs a concluding sentence that restates the main idea.&nbsp;<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><img alt=\"A diagram shows the 3 parts of a paragraph. The first part is the topic sentence. The second part is the supporting details. The last part is the concluding sentence.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","headerText":"Ending with a strong conclusion"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"14"},"leftText":"<p>Your brother&#39;s paragraph does not have a concluding sentence, so you add one.</p>","rightText":"<p>My stay at the Gravel Mountain Motel last October was uncomfortable and unpleasant.&nbsp; First of all, the shower produced only a trickle of cold water and the toilet overflowed.&nbsp; Additionally, the beds were lumpy and the mattresses were thin.&nbsp; The walls were flimsy, and we could hear loud music playing all night.&nbsp; The coffee at the free breakfast was weak and cold.&nbsp; Worst of all, that rude person at the front desk was no help to us.&nbsp; <span class=\"marker\">My vacation visit to your motel was the worst I have ever experienced.</span><br /><span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">The concluding sentence you added is &quot;My vacation visit to your motel was the worst I have ever experienced.&quot;</span></p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"15"},"leftText":"<p><img alt=\"\" src=\"/images/picture_it.png\" />&nbsp; <a href=\"S3_BUCKET_/CS16/6/Pictureit_Makesurethepartsworktogether.pdf\" onclick=\"window.open(this.href, '', 'resizable=yes,status=no,location=no,toolbar=no,menubar=no,fullscreen=no,scrollbars=no,dependent=yes,width=826,left=100,height=750,top=50'); height: 20px;\" /><span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">Screen reader version of make sure the parts work together, opens in a new tab</span></a><br />&nbsp;</p><table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-summary\" style=\"width:100%;\"><thead><tr><th scope=\"col\">Remember!</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><p>A great paragraph includes the following:</p><ul><li>a topic sentence, with a topic and a main idea</li><li>support that proves, explains, or shows what you are saying</li><li>sentences that all relate to the topic sentence</li><li>transition words that make your writing clear</li><li>a concluding sentence that restates the main idea</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":"Putting it all together"},{"settings":{"showAudio":0,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":""},"leftText":"<p>Your brother&#39;s letter is now much stronger.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Before your edits:</span></p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 70%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">To the Manager of the Gravel Mountain Motel:</span></p><p><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">The beds at the Gravel Mountain Motel are terrible! When I stayed there, I had a terrible time.&nbsp; I hated staying at the Gravel Mountain Motel.&nbsp; The beds were lumpy and the mattresses were thin.&nbsp; I will say that the free breakfast was hot and delicious.&nbsp; That rude person at the front desk was no help to us.</span></p><p><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">I want my money back!</span></p><p><span class=\"ju-examples\" style=\"color:#552656;font-family:tahoma;\">Cranky Customer</span><br />&nbsp;</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">After your edits:</span></p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" height=\"302\" width=\"378\"><tbody><tr><td><p>To the Manager of the Gravel Mountain Motel:</p><p>My stay at the Gravel Mountain Motel last October was uncomfortable and unpleasant.&nbsp; First of all, the shower produced only a trickle of cold water and the toilet overflowed.&nbsp; Additionally, the beds were lumpy and the mattresses were thin.&nbsp; The walls were flimsy, and we could hear loud music playing all night.&nbsp; The coffee at the free breakfast was weak and cold.&nbsp; Worst of all, that rude person at the front desk was no help to us.&nbsp; My vacation visit to your motel was the worst I have ever experienced.</p><p>I want my money back!</p><p>Cranky Customer</p></td></tr></tbody></table>"}],"overviewHeader":"Overview"}
